security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network access, or filesystem operations beyond reading its own documentation files.

content.user_title: Debug bugs systematically with four-phase framework
content.value_statement: Random fixes waste time and create new bugs. This skill enforces a rigorous four-phase debugging process that ensures you understand the root cause before attempting any solution, preventing symptom fixes that mask underlying problems.
actual_capabilities: Guides root cause investigation with error analysis and data flow tracing
Enforces pattern analysis against working code examples
Implements hypothesis testing with minimal changes for validation
Requires failing test case before implementing any fix
Detects anti-patterns like quick fixes and shotgun debugging
Handles failed fixes by questioning architecture instead of guessing more
limitations: Requires following all four phases - cannot skip to fixes
Does not run tests or examine code directly - guides the process
Will not propose solutions until root cause is identified
Time investment required - prevents quick symptom masking

use_cases.title: Fix bugs properly the first time
use_cases.description: Developers use this framework to avoid quick patches that create new bugs, ensuring fixes address root causes.

use_cases.title: Investigate test failures systematically
use_cases.description: QA engineers trace test failures through the four phases to understand why tests fail before attempting repairs.

use_cases.title: Debug production incidents under pressure
use_cases.description: DevOps teams follow this process even during production emergencies to prevent fixing symptoms instead of causes.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Bug Report
prompt_templates.prompt: A user reports that the login button does nothing when clicked. Use systematic-debugging to investigate before proposing any fix.

prompt_templates.title: Test Failure
prompt_templates.prompt: The build failed with: 'Expected 200 but got 500'. Use systematic-debugging to find the root cause before attempting any fix.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: The /api/users endpoint takes 10 seconds to respond. Use systematic-debugging to investigate the performance problem systematically.

prompt_templates.title: Production Emergency
prompt_templates.prompt: Production is down with connection timeouts. Use systematic-debugging to investigate - do NOT propose any fix until you understand the root cause.

output_examples.input: The build is failing with 'Cannot find module' error
output: Phase 1 - Root Cause Investigation: Checking if the module exists, reviewing recent dependency changes, tracing the import chain to identify where the module is expected vs. where it actually lives
Phase 2 - Pattern Analysis: Comparing against working imports in the codebase to identify what's different about this failing import
Phase 3 - Hypothesis: Forming a clear hypothesis about why the module cannot be found before attempting any fix
Phase 4 - Implementation: Creating a failing test that reproduces the issue, then implementing the fix at the root cause level

best_practices: Never propose fixes before completing root cause investigation - the Iron Law mandates understanding first
Test one hypothesis at a time with minimal changes - shotgun debugging creates new bugs
After three failed fix attempts, question the architecture rather than attempting more guesses
anti_patterns: Quick fix for now, investigate later - this creates technical debt and masks symptoms
Just try changing X and see if it works - creates new bugs and wastes time
Skipping the test because you will manually verify - untested fixes do not stick

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. Provides guidance for any LLM-based development workflow.

faq.question: How long does the full process take?
faq.answer: Simple bugs: 15-30 minutes. Complex issues: 1-2 hours. Faster than thrashing with random fixes.

faq.question: Can I skip phases under time pressure?
faq.answer: No. The skill explicitly resists this rationalization. Systematic debugging is faster than guess-and-check.

faq.question: What if I cannot find the root cause?
faq.answer: Document what was investigated. 95 percent of 'no root cause' cases are incomplete investigation. Add monitoring for future.

faq.question: How does this differ from TDD?
faq.answer: TDD writes tests before coding. This skill creates failing tests before fixing bugs to ensure the fix addresses the root cause.

faq.question: Does this work for performance issues?
faq.answer: Yes. Apply all four phases to performance problems. Find root cause of slowness before attempting optimization.
